verses.t: And{G1161} when{G5613} it was determined that{G2919} we{G2248} should sail{G636} into{G1519} Italy{G3588}, they delivered{G3860} Paul{G3972} and{G2532} certain{G5100} other{G2087} prisoners{G1202} unto{G3686} one named{G3686} Julius{G2457}, a centurion{G1543} of Augustus'{G4575} band{G4686}.

And{G1161} entering into{G1910} a ship{G4143} of Adramyttium{G98}, we launched{G321}, meaning{G3195} to sail{G4126} by{G2596} the coasts{G5117} of Asia{G3588}; one Aristarchus{G708}, a Macedonian{G3110} of Thessalonica{G2331}, being{G5607} with{G4862} us{G2254}.

And{G5037} the next{G2087} day we touched{G2609} at{G1519} Sidon{G4605}. And{G5037} Julius{G3588} courteously{G5364} entreated{G5530} Paul{G3588}, and gave{G2010} him liberty{G2010} to go{G4198} unto{G4314} his friends{G5384} to refresh himself{G5177}.
And when{G2547} we had launched{G321} from thence{G2547}, we sailed under{G5284} Cyprus{G3588}, because{G1223} the winds{G3588} were{G1511} contrary{G1727}.
And{G5037} when we had sailed over{G1277} the sea{G3989} of{G2596} Cilicia{G3588} and{G2532} Pamphylia{G3828}, we came{G2718} to{G1519} Myra{G3460}, a city of Lycia{G3588}.
And there{G2546} the centurion{G3588} found{G2147} a ship{G4143} of Alexandria{G222} sailing{G4126} into{G1519} Italy{G3588}; and he put{G1688} us{G2248} therein{G846}.

And{G1161} when{G1722} we had sailed slowly{G1020} many{G2425} days{G2250}, and{G2532} scarce{G3433} were come{G1096} over against{G2596} Cnidus{G3588}, the wind{G3588} not{G3361} suffering{G4330} us{G2248}, we sailed under{G5284} Crete{G3588}, over against{G2596} Salmone{G4534};

And{G5037}, hardly{G3433} passing{G3881} it{G846}, came{G2064} unto{G1519} a place{G5117} which{G5100} is called{G2564} The fair{G2568} havens{G2568}; nigh{G1451} whereunto{G3739} was{G2258} the city{G4172} of Lasea{G2996}.NOTE! Extra word: "kalos" and "limen"

Now{G1161} when much{G2425} time{G5550} was spent{G1230}, and{G2532} when sailing{G3588} was{G5607} now{G2235} dangerous{G2000}, because{G1223} the fast{G3588} was{G3928} now{G2532} already{G2235} past{G3928}, Paul{G3588} admonished{G3867} them,

And{G2532} said{G3004} unto them{G846}, Sirs{G435}, I perceive{G2334} that{G3754} this voyage{G3588} will{G3195} be{G2071} with{G3326} hurt{G5196} and much{G4183} damage{G2209}, not{G3756} only{G3440} of the lading{G3588} and{G2532} ship{G3588}, but{G235} also{G2532} of our{G2257} lives{G3588}.

Nevertheless{G1161} the centurion{G1543} believed{G3982} the master{G3588} and{G2532} the owner of the ship{G3588}, more{G3123} than{G2228} those things{G3588} which were spoken{G3004} by{G5259} Paul{G3588}.

And{G1161} because the haven{G3588} was{G5225} not commodious{G428} to{G4314} winter in{G3915}, the more part{G4119} advised{G5087} to depart{G321} thence also{G2547}, if by any means{G1513} they might{G1410} attain{G2658} to{G1519} Phenice{G5405}, and there to winter{G3914}; which is an haven{G3040} of Crete{G3588}, and lieth{G991} toward{G2596} the south west{G3047} and{G2532} north west{G5566}.
And{G1161} when the south wind{G3558} blew softly{G5285}, supposing that{G1380} they had obtained{G2902} their purpose{G3588}, loosing{G142} thence, they sailed{G3881} close{G788} by Crete{G3588}.
But{G1161} not{G3756} long{G4183} after{G3326} there arose{G906} against{G2596} it{G846} a tempestuous{G5189} wind{G417}, called{G2564} Euroclydon{G2148}.
And{G1161} when the ship{G3588} was caught{G4884}, and{G2532} could{G1410} not{G3361} bear up into{G503} the wind{G3588}, we let{G1929} her drive{G5342}.
And{G1161} running under{G5295} a certain{G5100} island{G3519} which is called{G2564} Clauda{G2802}, we had much{G2480} work{G3433} to come{G1096} by{G4031} the boat{G3588}:

Which{G3739} when they had taken up{G142}, they used{G5530} helps{G996}, undergirding{G5269} the ship{G3588}; and{G5037}, fearing{G5399} lest{G3361} they should fall{G1601} into{G1519} the quicksands{G3588}, strake{G5465} sail{G3588}, and so{G3779} were driven{G5342}.
And{G1161} we{G2257} being exceedingly{G4971} tossed with a tempest{G5492}, the next{G1836} day they lightened{G4160} the ship{G1546};
And{G2532} the third{G5154} day we cast out{G4496} with our own hands{G849} the tackling{G3588} of the ship{G3588}.

And{G1161} when neither{G3383} sun{G2246} nor{G3383} stars{G798} in{G1909} many{G4119} days{G2250} appeared{G2014}, and{G5037} no{G3756} small{G3641} tempest{G5494} lay on{G1945} us, all{G3956} hope{G1680} that we{G2248} should be saved{G4982} was{G4014} then{G3063} taken away{G4014}.

But{G1161} after{G5119} long{G4183} abstinence{G776} Paul{G3588} stood forth{G2476} in{G1722} the midst{G3319} of them{G846}, and said{G2036}, Sirs{G435}, ye should{G1163} have hearkened{G3980} unto me{G3427}, and{G321} not{G3361} have loosed{G321} from{G575} Crete{G3588}, and{G5037} to have gained{G2770} this{G3778} harm{G3588} and{G2532} loss{G3588}.

And{G2532} now{G3867} I exhort{G5209} you{G2114} to be of good cheer{G580}: for{G5590} there shall be{G1537} no{G2071} loss of{G1063} any man's life{G3762} among{G5216} you{G4133}, but{G3588} of the ship{G4143}.NOTE! Scrambled tags!
For{G1063} there stood{G3936} by me{G3427} this{G3778} night{G3588} the angel{G32} of God{G3588}, whose{G3739} I am{G1510}, and{G2532} whom{G3739} I serve{G3000},

Saying{G3004}, Fear{G5399} not{G3361}, Paul{G3972}; thou{G4571} must be{G1163} brought before{G3936} CÃ¦sar{G2541}and{G2532}, lo{G2400}, God{G3588} hath given{G5483} thee{G4671} all{G3956} them{G3588} that sail{G4126} with{G3326} thee{G4675}.
Wherefore{G1352}, sirs{G435}, be of good cheer{G2114}: for{G1063} I believe{G4100} God{G3588}, that{G3754} it{G3779} shall be{G2071} even{G2596} as{G5158} it was told{G2980} me{G3427}.
Howbeit{G1161} we{G2248} must{G1163} be cast{G1601} upon{G1519} a certain{G5100} island{G3520}.

But{G1161} when{G5613} the fourteenth{G5065} night{G3571} was come{G1096}, as we{G2257} were driven up and down{G1308} in{G1722} Adria{G3588}, about{G2596} midnight{G3588} the shipmen{G3588} deemed that{G5282} they{G846} drew near to{G4317} some{G5100} country{G5561};

And{G2532} sounded{G1001}, and found{G2147} it twenty{G1501} fathoms{G3712}: and{G1161} when they had gone{G1339} a little further{G1024}, they sounded{G1001} again{G3825}, and{G2532} found{G2147} it fifteen{G1178} fathoms{G3712}.

Then{G5037} fearing{G5399} lest{G3381} we should have fallen{G1601} upon{G1519} rocks{G5138}, they cast{G4496} four{G5064} anchors{G45} out of{G1537} the stern{G4403}, and wished{G2172} for{G1096} the day{G2250}.

And{G1161} as the shipmen{G3492} were about{G2212} to flee{G5343} out of{G1537} the ship{G3588}, when{G2532} they had let down{G5465} the boat{G3588} into{G1519} the sea{G3588}, under colour{G4392} as though{G5613} they would{G3195} have cast{G1614} anchors{G45} out of{G1537} the foreship{G4408},
Paul{G3588} said{G2036} to the centurion{G3588} and{G2532} to the soldiers{G3588}, Except{G1437} these{G3778} abide{G3306} in{G1722} the ship{G3588}, ye{G5210} cannot{G3756} be saved{G4982}.
Then{G5119} the soldiers{G3588} cut off{G609} the ropes{G3588} of the boat{G3588}, and{G2532} let{G1439} her{G846} fall off{G1601}.

And{G1161} while{G891} the day{G2250} was{G3195} coming on{G1096}, Paul{G3588} besought{G3870} them all{G537} to take{G3335} meat{G5160}, saying{G3004}, This day{G4594} is the fourteenth{G5065} day{G2250} that{G3739} ye have tarried{G4328} and continued{G1300} fasting{G777}, having taken{G4355} nothing{G3367}.

Wherefore{G1352} I pray{G3870} you{G5209} to take{G4355} some meat{G5160}: for{G1063} this is{G5124} for{G4314} your{G5212} health{G4991}: for{G1063} there shall{G5225} not{G3762} an hair{G2359} fall{G4098} from{G1537} the head{G3588} of any of you{G5216}.

And when{G1161} he had{G2036} thus{G5023} spoken{G2036}, he took{G2983} bread{G740}, and{G2532} gave thanks{G2168} to God{G3588} in presence{G1799} of them all{G3956}: and{G2532} when he had broken{G2806} it, he began{G756} to eat{G2068}.
Then{G1161} were{G1096} they all{G3956} of good cheer{G2115}, and{G2532} they{G846} also took{G4355} some meat{G5160}.
And{G1161} we were{G1510} in all{G3956} in{G1722} the ship{G3588} two hundred{G1250} threescore and{G1440} sixteen{G1803} souls{G5590}.
And when{G1161} they had eaten{G2880} enough{G5160}, they lightened{G2893} the ship{G3588}, and cast out{G1544} the wheat{G3588} into{G1519} the sea{G3588}.

And{G1161} when{G3753} it was{G1096} day{G2250}, they knew{G1921} not{G3756} the land{G3588}: but{G1161} they discovered{G2657} a certain{G5100} creek{G2859} with{G2192} a shore{G123}, into{G1519} the which{G3739} they were minded{G1011}, if{G1487} it were possible{G1410}, to thrust{G1856} in the ship{G3588}.

And{G2532} when they had taken up{G4014} the anchors{G3588}, they committed{G1439} themselves unto{G1519} the sea{G3588}, and{G260} loosed{G447} the rudder{G3588} bands{G3588}, and{G2532} hoised up{G1869} the mainsail{G3588} to the wind{G4154}, and made{G2722} toward{G1519} shore{G3588}.

And{G1161} falling{G4045} into{G1519} a place{G5117} where two seas met{G1337}, they ran{G2027} the ship{G3588} aground{G2027}; and{G2532} the forepart{G4408} stuck fast{G2043}, and remained{G3306} unmoveable{G761}, but{G1161} the hinder part{G4403} was broken{G3089} with{G5259} the violence{G3588} of the waves{G3588}.
And{G1161} the soldiers'{G4757} counsel{G1012} was{G1096} to{G2443} kill{G615} the prisoners{G3588}, lest{G3361} any{G5100} of them should swim out{G1579}, and escape{G1309}.

But{G1161} the centurion{G1543}, willing{G1014} to save{G1295} Paul{G3588}, kept{G2967} them{G846} from{G3588} their purpose{G1013}; and{G5037} commanded that{G2753} they{G3588} which could{G1410} swim{G2860} should cast{G641} themselves first{G4413} into the sea, and get{G1826} to{G1909} land{G3588}:

And{G2532} the rest{G3062}, some{G3739} on{G1909} boards{G4548}, and{G1161} some{G3739} on{G1909} broken pieces of{G575} the ship{G3588}. And{G2532} so{G3779} it came to pass{G1096}, that they escaped{G1295} all{G3956} safe{G1295} to{G1909} land{G3588}.
